page.title: 11FARMING
page.content: The most important industry in this area is{Farming.}Most of the land belongs to the estates of{Lord {Malmesbury}and{Lord Manners}and is therefore farmed on their behalves. The{River Avon}which runs right through the area provides a wide flood plain which is ideal grazing land for the{Dairy Farming.}The most commonly used dairy cattle are the black and white{Friesians}but you can occasionally see the odd{Jersey}or{ {Ayrshire}grazing in mixed herds. Above the level of the flood plain a rich, fertile soil provides good arable land which the farmers use for growing{cereal crops, maize, {vegetables and summer fruits.} As we are situated in the south of England many local farmers take advantage of the mild climate to grow early vegtables and soft fruits.
